name: Paul Adenot
subject: Have the OscillatorNode.frequency nominal range to be [-nyquist, +nyquist].
body: This fixe issue #813.

name: Mikhail Pozdnyakov
subject: Fix #830 by converting 'outputTimeStamp' attribute to method
body: Whereas 'AudioContext.outputTimeStamp' attribute is returning a new object every time it should be converted to a method.

name: Paul Adenot
subject: Fix garbage introduced in previous commit.

name: Paul Adenot
subject: Fix MathJax
body:
https://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/spec-prod/2016AprJun/0052.html tells us
that the behaviour has been inversed, we need to annotate the maths so that it
does not get highlighted by hljs and then processed by MathJax that gets very
confused.

Also removed the deprecated "highlight" attribute from code examples and spec
bloc.

name: Raymond Toy
subject: Fix #821: specify behavior of setValueCurveAtTime
body:
setValueCurveAtTime is modified so that an implicit call to
setValueAtTime is made at the end of the curve duration.  This makes
any following automation events start from the end of the
setValueCurveAtTime event with the last value of the curve.

Without this, a linearRamp following setValueCurve would replace
setValueCurve.  This is not the desired behavior.

The definition of AudioContextOptions was in the BaseAudioContext
section.  But this dictionary is only applicable for AudioContexts.
Move it to the AudioContext section.

subject: Fix #815: setValueCurve should throw on non-finite elements.
body:
If the curve contains non-finite values, setValueCurveAtTime must
signal a TypeError.  These values are illegal.

The AudioParam nominal range attributes min/max are renamed to
minValue and maxValue.

name: Raymond Toy
subject: Fix #766: Behavior of automations and nominal ranges
body:
Specify the behavior of automations with nominal ranges.  Automations
are internally computed as there were no nominal ranges.  Only when
they are applied is the clamping done.  A simple example is given.

name: Mikhail Pozdnyakov
subject: Fix #12 by adding 'AudioDestinationNode.outputTimeStamp' and 'AudioDestinationNode.outputLatency'
body: This patch introduces 'AudioDestinationNode.outputTimeStamp' and 'AudioDestinationNode.outputLatency' attributes, so that it's possible to estimate when the given context's stream position is audible.

Automatically converted Windows style to Unix style end-of-line
character.

Fix #804.

subject: Fix #798: Incorrect nominal range for Biquad Q
body:
The actual nominal range is (-infinity, +infinity) since Q is in dB
and the valid range for the linear Q value is (0, infinity).

complete the set of nominal ranges so that AudioParam min/max
attributes can be properly set for each AudioParam.

body: Update links and other references appropriately.

subject: Merge pull request #782 from marcoscaceres/gh-pages
body: Feat (index.html): don't use Mathjax during spec-generation

name: Raymond Toy
subject: Fix #771 by using Audio Cookbook formula
body:
Use the Audio Cookbook formula for the lowpass and highpass filters.
However, the cookbook has Q in linear units.  This change makes Q in
dB.  This preserves the old behavior which used Q in dB for the
lowpass and highpass filters, so that automations have the same value.
(See #769)

This also minimizes the difference in sound quality between these new
filters and the old ones.

name: Raymond Toy
subject: Fix #748:  Remove constructor from BaseAudioContext
body:
Move the constructor from BaseAudioContext to AudioContext where it
belongs; BaseAudioContext is not constructible.

name: Raymond Toy
subject: Fix #760 by widening the range to (-inf,inf)
body:
Change the nominal range of the Biquad gain parameter to be any real
value.

name: Paul Adenot
subject: Make it so that the lower bound for the required sample-rate is 8000
body: Because 8192 is not very common for sample-rates.

body: 759 biquad gain is db

subject: Merge pull request #397 from WebAudio/349-destination-output
body:
Make the AudioDestinationNode have an output.

Fix #349.

name: Raymond Toy
subject: Fix #348: Add latencyHint
body:
This updates and replaces the current playbackCategory to a
latencyHint that accepts an AudioContextLatencyCategory (a renaming of
AudioContextPlaybackCategory to reflect better the actual intent) or a
double for finer control of the latency.

An additional attribute, processingLatency, is added to the
BaseAudioContext to indicate what latency was actually used by the
context.

name: Raymond Toy
subject: Fix #749: Merge SpatialPannerNode to PannerNode
body:
Merge the SpatialPannerNode into the PannerNode, undeprecating the
PannerNode.  The SpatialListener is also merged into the
AudioListener, which is undeprecated as well.

The setPosition and setOrientation methods for both the PannerNode and
AudioListener are also deprecated because they can be done using the
corresponding AudioParams.

name: Raymond Toy
subject: Fix #759:  biquad gain is in dB
body:
Add text to say that the gain parameter is in dB.  Also mention which
filters actually use the gain.

Also took this opportunity to say that Q is not used for some filters.

name: Raymond Toy

body:
The scalar attributes such as refDistance, maxDistance, rolloffFactor,
and the cone angles for the PannerNode (and SpatialPannerNode) are
changed from float to double because Chrome, Firefox, and Safari
actually implement them as doubles in both the IDL files and the
internal implementation.

name: Raymond Toy
subject: Scale the FFT by 1/N in the AnalyserNode
body:
Apply a scale factor to the FFT so that a 0 dbFS sine wave is 0 dBfs.

Chrome does this; I didn't check anywhere else, but it makes sense
that the FFT output should have the same amplitude as the input,
instead of leaving the FFT unscaled.

Fix 725.

name: Raymond Toy
subject: Truncate float to integer for Analyser.getByte.*Data
body:
Explicitly say that the byte data is computed from the floating point
data by truncating the float to an integer.

Fix #722

body:
Fix #695 by reverting the change and also specifying that angles
outside the interval [0, 360] invokes undefined behavior.

name: Raymond Toy
subject: Replace 0.7071 with sqrt(0.5)
body: Fix issue #718.  I think the intent is use sqrt(0.5) and not 0.7071.

body: Fix #714 by adding spatialListener attribute.

name: Raymond Toy
subject: Specify behavior of setValueCurveAtTime parameters.
body:
If the curve has fewer than 2 points and error is thrown.  If the
duration is not strictly positive (and finite), an error is also
thrown.

name: Raymond Toy
subject: Specify initial event for linear and exponential ramp.
body:
If there is no event preceding a linearRampToValueAtTime or
exponentialRampToValueAtTime, specify that these behave as if a
setValueAtTime were inserted at the context currentTime with the
current attribute value at the time of the call.

Fix #130.

name: Raymond Toy
subject: createIIRFilter takes double coefficients
body:
The coefficients for createIIRFilter are explicitly doubles and not
floats now.

We also fix a minor issue that was accepted in
WebAudio/web-audio-api#323 where a sequence<float> was allowed instead
of Float32Array to make it easier for the developer to specify
coefficients.

Note that for some reason respec replaces sequence<double> with just
sequence in the document.  Is this a bug in respec?

Fix WebAudio/web-audio-api#631

name: joeberkovitz
subject: Further clarify the definition of AudioContext.currentTime in terms of last-processed block, not next-processed block.

name: Paul Adenot
subject: Hack around wrapping in tidy HTML to keep nicely formatted formulas
body:
This wraps formulas in `pre` tags that are ignored by tidy, and we enabled their parsing in MathJax.
This also tidies the document.

name: Raymond Toy
subject: Specify exponential ramp behavior when previous value is 0
body:
Clarify what happens if the previous event value is 0.  We also
explicitly allow v0 and v1 to both be negative (the formula is
well-defined in this case).

If an error is thrown, the previous value is propagated.

Fixes WebAudio/web-audio-api#612.

name: Raymond Toy
subject: Specify PeriodicWave coefficients to generate basic Oscillator waveforms.
body:
Include formulas appropriate for PeriodicWave objects to create the
basic builtin Oscillator waveforms.

Fixes WebAudio/web-audio-api#569.

subject: Wrap lines to make them shorter. (Why didn't tidy do that?)

name: Raymond Toy
subject: setTargetAtTime timeConstant must be positive
body: Fix WebAudio/web-audio-api#616

name: Raymond Toy
subject: Describe how byte values are computed for getByteTimeDomainData and getByteFrequencyData.

lie between d_ref and d_max (or infinity) as appropriate.

subject: Fix #5: Add setTargetAtTime curve to example
body:
The graph of parameter automation is updated to include an example of
setTargetAtTime with the code update appropriately.  The graph also
includes some simple annotation of each part and also gives an example
of how to have another automation follow a setTargetAtTime.  A
setValueAtTime is required to terminate the setTargetAtTime and give a
starting value for the following exponentialRampToValueAtTime.

dB. The smoothing section is also replaced with mathematical notation
instead of code.

The filter coefficients are fixed and cannot be changed.  The maximum
number of coefficients is 20.

results as if a PeriodicWave with the appropriate Fourier coefficients
were used to create the oscillator.

name: Paul ADENOT
subject: Use DOM4 exception instead of legacy names
body:
Patch generated mostly with the following script, assuming GNU sed:

    #!/bin/sh
    FILE=index.html

    sed -i 's/INDEX_SIZE_ERR/IndexSizeError/' $FILE
    sed -i 's/HIERARCHY_REQUEST_ERR/HierarchyRequestError/' $FILE
    sed -i 's/WRONG_DOCUMENT_ERR/WrongDocumentError/' $FILE
    sed -i 's/INVALID_CHARACTER_ERR/InvalidCharacterError/' $FILE
    sed -i 's/NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR/NoModificationAllowedError/' $FILE
    sed -i 's/NOT_FOUND_ERR/NotFoundError/' $FILE
    sed -i 's/NOT_SUPPORTED_ERR/NotSupportedError/' $FILE
    sed -i 's/INUSE_ATTRIBUTE_ERR/InUseAttributeError/' $FILE
    sed -i 's/INVALID_STATE_ERR/InvalidStateError/' $FILE
    sed -i 's/SYNTAX_ERR/SyntaxError/' $FILE
    sed -i 's/INVALID_MODIFICATION_ERR/InvalidModificationError/' $FILE
    sed -i 's/NAMESPACE_ERR/NamespaceError/' $FILE
    sed -i 's/INVALID_ACCESS_ERR/InvalidAccessError/' $FILE
    sed -i 's/TYPE_MISMATCH_ERR/TypeMismatchError/' $FILE
    sed -i 's/SECURITY_ERR/SecurityError/' $FILE
    sed -i 's/NETWORK_ERR/NetworkError/' $FILE
    sed -i 's/ABORT_ERR/AbortError/' $FILE
    sed -i 's/URL_MISMATCH_ERR/URLMismatchError/' $FILE
    sed -i 's/QUOTA_EXCEEDED_ERR/QuotaExceededError/' $FILE
    sed -i 's/TIMEOUT_ERR/TimeoutError/' $FILE
    sed -i 's/INVALID_NODE_TYPE_ERR/InvalidNodeTypeError/' $FILE
    sed -i 's/DATA_CLONE_ERR/DataCloneError/' $FILE
    sed -i 's/INVALID_POINTER_ERR/InvalidPointerId/' $FILE

name: Paul ADENOT
subject: Remove broken link to #ExampleApplications
body: This section does not exist anymore.

name: Domenic Denicola
subject: OfflineAudioContext.prototype.startRendering returns a promise
body: The steps are now more clearly sequenced and outlined, which helps make things explicit: e.g. the same `AudioBuffer` instance is used for both the event and the promise, and the details of how the buffer gets filled and initialized are no longer spread out across the method definition, the event definition, and the introductory paragraph.

name: Domenic Denicola
subject: Rewrite decodeAudioData to return a promise.
body: It still takes the callbacks, although they are now optional and noted as legacy.

subject: Clarify the processing applied before and after the FFT in AnalyserNode

subject: Note that an error must be thrown if the buffer does not have 1, 2, or 4 channels.

name: Paul Adenot
subject: Make OscillatorNode.{start, end} like AudioBufferSourceNode's
body:
OscillatorNode.{start, end} argument is now optional, and default to zero, so it
is similar to AudioBufferSourceNode methods.

name: Paul Adenot
subject: ReSpec-ize the new section on oscillator types, and fix markup.

name: Chris Wilson
subject: Removal of Example Applications and Recording Impulse Responses sections.
body:
As per http://www.w3.org/2011/audio/track/actions/80.  After reading
carefully, there is nothing in these sections that is not either
confusing disconnected (IR) or duplicative with the scenarios laid out
in a separate document (Example Apps).

name: Chris Wilson
subject: Revert "Remove Example Applications and Recording Impulse Responses sections."
body: This reverts commit f82682f2901fe5938d41fb158653e443212677ad.

name: Chris Wilson
subject: Remove Example Applications and Recording Impulse Responses sections.
body:
Per http://www.w3.org/2011/audio/track/actions/80:  These sections are
of questionable value, and raise licensing concerns.

INDEX_SIZE_ERR is thrown.
